description: ZIGPOS is a technology company specializing in real-time locating systems (RTLS) for the Internet of Things (IoT). Founded in 2011 as a spin-off from the University of Applied Sciences (HTW) Dresden, ZIGPOS offers solutions for accurate indoor and outdoor positioning in complex industrial environments, including semiconductors, automotive, electrical/IT, mechanical engineering, medicine, shipping, and logistics. Their core product, Coriva, is a UWB (ultra-wideband) based RTLS that uses CorivaTags (mobile devices) and CorivaSats (infrastructure) to track assets with an accuracy of up to 30cm. The CorivaEngine processes the position data and makes it available through standardized interfaces, even in distributed and cloud environments. ZIGPOS's technology is compliant with UWB-Alliance, IEEE 802.15.4, and omlox standards. The company emphasizes innovation, reliability, and responsibility, aiming to make RTLS efficiently usable and expand market leadership, particularly with the Omlox standard. TRUMPF acquired a 50.1% stake in ZIGPOS in 2019 and 2021, highlighting its importance as a development partner for TRUMPF's Track&Trace RTLS. ZIGPOS's mission is to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and create foundations for growth through its technology, benefiting society, customers, and the environment.

Their products include rolls for the steel, paper, rubber & plastics, and food industries, as well as wear-resistant cast parts for stone-earth, brick, and wet dredging industries, and pistons for hydraulic presses. description: Status Pro Maschinenmesstechnik GmbH, founded in 1995, operates as a manufacturer, dealer, and repair service for machine metrology equipment. The company divides its offerings into four main areas. First, Werkzeugmaschinen-Kalibrierung (Machine Tool Calibration) which includes interferometers, precision inclinometers, machine levels, and laser measurement technology for machine tool measurement, focusing on alignment, calibration, and diagnostics. Second, Maschinengeometrie (Machine Geometry) which involves measuring straightness, flatness, squareness, and leveling using lasers and photogrammetry for machine builders, with applications like flange flatness and borehole positioning. Third, Internet of Things (IoT), where Status Pro develops SPIoT sensors for autonomous and flexible measurement and data transmission without extensive installation. Fourth, Wellenausrichten (Shaft Alignment) which uses laser measurement technology and devices for shaft alignment, including shims and related tools, applicable to motor-pump systems and machines with various couplings. The company also offers services such as engineering surveying, repair and calibration, and a rental equipment service. They provide training for distributors, emphasizing knowledge transfer and hands-on experience with their measurement lasers and precision levels. Status Pro serves various industries requiring precise measurement and alignment of machinery.

description: SysTec Systemtechnik und Industrieautomation GmbH specializes in industrial weighing indicators and controllers designed for scale builders, plant engineers, and system integrators. They provide solutions for filling and bagging systems, belt weighers, check scales, vehicle scales, and more. They also offer accessories for weighing indicators, standard application software, and service tools. The company provides options for private label branding and offers fast delivery times. SysTec supports the MQTT protocol and REST API interface for IoT and IT system integration. Their weighing indicators are available with ATEX approval for hazardous zones.

description: Fusion Bionic GmbH, founded in April 2021 as a spin-off of the Fraunhofer IWS and the Technische Universität Dresden, specializes in functionalizing surfaces using laser textures, inspired by nature and bionics. They offer solutions based on Direct Laser Interference Patterning (DLIP) to improve surface performance in various industries, including automotive, aerospace, and medical technology. Their technology enables the replication of functional surface textures found in nature on a large scale, offering benefits such as improved anti-icing, reduced friction and wear, enhanced biocompatibility, and antibacterial properties. Fusion Bionic's CORE series includes modular interference modules (CORE, CORErapid, COREultra) for surface functionalization, offering various wavelengths, pattern geometries, and structure sizes adjustable via software. These solutions eliminate the need for cleanrooms, vacuum, or additional chemicals, while providing high process speeds. The company's services include consulting, individual solutions, integration support, F&E collaboration, production, and training. Fusion Bionic aims to combine nature-inspired effects into technical product surfaces, creating a symbiosis of technology and biology.

description: BIBUS GmbH is a German company offering a range of products and solutions in pneumatics, mechatronics, environmental technology, semiconductor technology, vehicle parts, and vacuum technology. The company emphasizes customer-specific solutions, system integration, and support from component selection to system assembly. They aim to provide solutions where standard products are insufficient and focus on innovation and individual customer needs.

description: Niezgodka is a German manufacturer specializing in the development and construction of safety and control valves. They supply distributors and end customers in Europe and worldwide, catering to individual needs. Their product range includes safety valves, relief and overflow valves, pressure reducing valves, pre-pressure regulators, ventilation valves, and combined over- and under-pressure valves, with certain series available in food and pharmaceutical versions. Standard materials for their valves are steel, cast steel, and stainless steel, with special materials available upon request, such as Duplex, Superduplex, Hastelloy, or Titanium. The valves are used in various industries, including plant construction, beverage and brewery technology, food technology, pharmaceutical technology, petrochemicals, natural gas and oil production, marine engineering, power plant technology, and hydrogen refueling. Niezgodka emphasizes operational safety, prevention of health and environmental damage, and smooth process flows with economic efficiency. Their valves are designed and manufactured according to the latest technology and relevant standards for safety valves, such as the Pressure Equipment Directive 2014/68/EU, AD2000 Merkblätter A2 and A4, DIN-EN-ISO-4126, DIN-EN-12266, and DIN-EN-12516. The company is certified according to DIN EN ISO 9001 by TÜV Nord, ensuring consistent product quality and traceability. They also have general approvals for safety valves from TÜV Nord, Lloyds Register, and DNV GL. They also have approvals for the Russian Customs Union market.

GSEC's systems are designed to meet the increasing demands for cleanliness in chip production, particularly with smaller structures. They collaborate with top players in the global semiconductor industry to anticipate and incorporate future requirements into their system development, including solutions for EUV (Extreme Ultra Violet) technology. GSEC offers several patented ultra-purification solutions, including: GFPS Purification Systems for FOUPS, a fully automated AMHS integrated system for FOUP purification; GRPS Purification Systems for RSP, a fully automated on-demand RSP purification system; and GEPS Purification Systems for EUV, a fully automated EUV pod cleaner for AMHS integrated HOST driven operation. These systems focus on separating surfaces to avoid cross-contamination, maximizing throughput while minimizing footprint, and offering modular designs for fast build-up and installation. GSEC aims to improve manufacturing processes by providing total solutions for decontaminating wafer and reticle carriers with fully integrated and automated systems, offering services from design and development to after-sales support.

description: Dosch Messapparate GmbH, located in Berlin, specializes in differential pressure and flow measurement solutions. They offer a range of products including differential pressure transmitters, flow monitors, and pressure, temperature, and humidity measurement devices. Their products cater to various industries such as oil, gas, chemical, energy, pharmaceutical, paper, food, steel, and shipbuilding. Dosch provides solutions for monitoring liquid and gaseous media, even in aggressive or contaminated conditions, and at high or low pressures. Their product line includes orifice plates, Venturi tubes, and pitot tubes. The company emphasizes quality, service, flexibility, and partnership, offering customized solutions tailored to individual customer requirements and adhering to national and international standards. They provide consulting and support throughout the project lifecycle. Dosch Messapparate also manufactures U-tube and inclined tube manometers for small pressure measurements, particularly for oven construction and ventilation technology. Their flow monitors are designed for durability in harsh industrial environments and are available as pendulum devices for liquids and gases, and as vane sensors for gases. The company highlights its long-standing experience and commitment to continuous improvement. They also emphasize their ability to provide flexible solutions with short decision-making processes and customized delivery times. Dosch Messapparate aims to be a reliable partner, offering consulting services to find the best measurement solutions for their clients' systems.

The company was founded in 2016 by the Olma family.

description: Sphaira Medical GmbH, operating as MOBY, is a company focused on developing and providing mobile protective vehicles for medical isolation and patient transport. Their primary product, MOBY P1, is designed to offer physical protection and germ-proof isolation, exceeding typical hospital requirements with an ISO Class 2 cleanroom environment, comparable to NASA spacecraft assembly environments. It is certified as a Class I medical device under the Medical Device Regulation (EU MDR). MOBY P1 aims to improve outcomes for patients requiring strict isolation by facilitating safe intra-hospital transport, emotional support, and social interaction. The vehicle features high-grade air filtration with dual HEPA filters, air and gas-tight secure closure, 360-degree visibility, active and passive electric drive, modular access ports for medical devices, and a digital intercom for clear communication. It is designed for use in various scenarios, including care for highly infectious patients, reverse isolation for immunocompromised patients, and at-home isolation. Sphaira partners with hospitals like Charité and Medical Park to refine and deploy their technology. They also collaborate with Nvidia and participate in the Inception Program to leverage AI for autonomous patient mobility. Sphaira's mission is rooted in protecting and assisting isolation patients and fostering community, promoting mobility, driving impact, and safeguarding our shared home. The company was founded in 2020 and has offices in Berlin, Germany, and Cambridge, Massachusetts.

description: PIXARGUS, founded in 1999 in Aachen, Germany, specializes in machine vision technology for automated surface inspection and dimension measurement. The company provides systems for inline quality control of continuously produced long products and single parts, including profiles, tubing, tubes, webs, and cables, made from various materials. Their systems are used 24/7 by leading manufacturers in the automotive, healthcare, building and infrastructure, and consumer goods sectors. PIXARGUS systems inspect sealing profiles, hoses, tubes, catheters, cables, window frame profiles, compounds made of TPE and rubber, foils, and technological webs. They also serve the carbon composites and fiber market, inspecting webs and sheet products made of carbon composites and carbon fiber roving, and the medical engineering sector, providing inline quality inspection of tubing to clean room specifications. PIXARGUS offers a range of products including ProfilControl 7 Surface, ProfilControl 7 Dimension, ProfilControl 7 DualVision, iProfilControl, ProfilControl 7 ICSM, and others, each designed for specific inspection tasks. These systems utilize high-performance machine vision technology and are available in Classic, Factory, Basic, and Engineered Solutions to cater to different production line complexities and investment levels. The company's solutions provide non-contact inline quality control, measuring surface defects, dimensions, and inner geometry using multi-camera sensors and sophisticated algorithms. PIXARGUS emphasizes scalability, modularity, and Industry 4.0 readiness, offering features like intelligent networking, data integration, and user-friendly operation via multi-touch screens. Optional software modules, such as DDM (DefectDensityManagement), Drill Hole Control, Flock Inspection, Shiny Surface, Multi Extrusion, Groove Detection, and Saw Control, provide additional functionalities for specific inspection needs. PIXARGUS is headquartered in Würselen near Aachen, Germany, and operates worldwide through its US branch and international representations.

description: WEMA Glauchau is a German company specializing in the development and manufacturing of grinding machines. They offer a range of universal, internal, and external cylindrical grinding machines under the WOTAN® brand. Their machines are customizable to meet specific customer needs, with various sizes, configurations, and extensions available. WEMA Glauchau emphasizes precision, with over 100 years of experience in achieving high roundness accuracy, even for large and deep workpieces. Their machines feature the WoP™ (werkstattorientierte Oberfläche) interface for easy control and monitoring, and they offer Industry 4.0 integration with the WoP™Touch-Interface. The machines are built with solid machine beds for stability and long-term precision. They also offer integrated measurement solutions for in-machine quality checks. WEMA Glauchau provides solutions for grinding, drilling, and threading in a single setup using automated tool changing systems. They cater to industries such as railway (radsatzbearbeitung), aerospace, automotive, and general mechanical engineering, offering solutions for workpieces up to 1.3 tons with bores up to 1.200 mm. The company is part of the NSH Group and offers services including maintenance, repair, general overhauling, and contract manufacturing. They are certified according to ISO 9001:2015. WEMA Glauchau is expanding its presence in North America, leveraging synergies with the NSH USA.

description: Sipwise GmbH is a company that empowers Telecom Operators and Internet Service Providers (ISPs) with advanced communication products and solutions. Sipwise offers a range of products, including the C5 SOFT SWITCH (a flexible and scalable SIP/XMPP soft-switch for voice, video, presence, messaging, and WebRTC), the C4 SOFT SWITCH (a highly scalable carrier-grade calls switch), CPBX (a platform for hosted UC and PBX features for B2B/SME customers), LI (a solution for lawful interception), RB (an enterprise-grade cloud communication platform), RTPENGINE (an RTP proxy designed to enhance real-time communication sessions), MG (a signaling and media gateway), and SIP PHONE (a VoIP/SIP phone app). These products cater to B2B, residential, and enterprise communication needs, including virtual PBX, mobile clients, video calls, web conferences, file sharing, and SIP trunking. Sipwise's solutions are built on open and flexible software architecture, utilizing standard APIs and interfaces, including WebRTC and RTP:engine technology. They aim to provide efficient, simple, innovative, and profitable solutions, reducing total cost of ownership for their customers. The company emphasizes carrier-grade reliability, scalability, and integration capabilities, offering features like routing, LNP lookup, header manipulation, and PSTN/TDM interconnection. Sipwise also provides customer self-care interfaces, administrator web interfaces, reseller web interfaces, provisioning systems, billing and rating engines, and monitoring and lawful intercept capabilities. Their solutions are designed for easy integration into existing IT infrastructure and offer customization options. Sipwise targets Telecom Operators and ISPs, offering solutions for both residential and business markets.

description: CREFORM Technik GmbH is a German manufacturer specializing in customized industrial robots, automation systems, and pipe racking systems. Founded in 1953, they are known as the original inventor of the Kaizen pipe racking system. Their product offerings include a modular pipe and joint system (available in steel, stainless steel, and ESD materials), roller tracks and rails, system components, ergonomic height adjustments, Karakuri add-ons, individual panels, and various accessories and tools, including CAD software (CREFORM Designer). CREFORM offers services including planning and design, assembly and delivery, maintenance and inspection, customer support, and consulting (Muda-Walk, One-Piece-Flow, FTS/AMR). They also provide workshops and training, including 5S, Karakuri, and CAD training. CREFORM targets various industries, including automotive, logistics/e-commerce, and medical/laboratory technology. They emphasize individual, lean solutions to improve productivity and efficiency. Their solutions focus on material transport, production and assembly lines, logistics trains/milk runs, container transport, and overall economic efficiency. They also offer driverless transport systems (FTS/AMR) to optimize plant and operational potential. The company provides lean consulting services with over 25 years of experience, offering tailored solutions and analyses to help customers achieve their goals.

It supports businesses and professionals in navigating the opportunities of AM by facilitating exchange and knowledge sharing. The network's activities span user and application market development, addressing overarching topics like approval, materials, digital supply chain, sustainability, and education. MGA has active members from across the AM ecosystem, including users, OEMs, machine and material manufacturers, service providers, digital solution providers, and research institutes. The network aims to lower production barriers and jointly develop scalable, high-quality solutions in Additive Manufacturing. MGA operates through working groups and events, focusing on areas like RAILiability, hospitals, vehicles & machines, assistive technologies, lifestyle, construction, aero & space, dental, public urban transport, veterinary medicine, defense, and pharmaceutics. They address challenges such as high initial investments, skilled workforce shortages, and legal complexities associated with Additive Manufacturing.

description: Vegalab is a company dedicated to building a sustainable future through biotechnological innovation, manufacturing natural and organic agrochemicals, skincare, medical cleaning products and pharmaceutical supplements. They aim to match the price and efficacy of synthetic chemicals with their natural alternatives, utilizing micronization and nano-encapsulation to magnify the effects of all-natural ingredients. Their proprietary formulations allow them to create highly effective new products at a lower cost and faster time to market compared to makers of competitive synthetic products. Vegalab's offerings include organic nematicides, transdermal delivery systems for active ingredients (Vegalab Air In System), insecticides, fungicides, biocontrol agents, soil inoculants, fertilizers, plant amendments, and specialty products. They serve the agriculture, cosmetics, health, and animal care industries. Vegalab's business model includes manufacturing and distribution of their own branded products, as well as providing OEM services to qualified distributors and resellers. Catrobat emphasizes a constructionist approach, bypassing traditional school pedagogy and focusing on fun and engaging app creation. Their mission is to provide young people with the chance to include simple logical processes, creative solutions and easily understandable connections in their everyday digital-life.

description: Wirtschafts-Standort Vorarlberg GmbH (WISTO) is a service organization focused on promoting innovation and the uniqueness of Vorarlberg's economy. WISTO offers services such as grants for R&D, business settlement support, technology transfer and IPR consulting, SDG and ESG consulting, regional development and location analysis, innovation networks, and talent services through CHANCENLAND VORARLBERG. WISTO is owned by Vorarlberg's government, Hypo-Landesbank Vorarlberg, and Wirtschaftskammer Vorarlberg. The Circular Economy Vorarlberg (CEV) initiative aims to raise awareness for a sustainable and circular economy, supporting local businesses and fostering a green economy in Vorarlberg. CEV offers events, workshops, innovation challenges, and research projects. description:
LANCO, established in 1953, is a manufacturer specializing in tents, decontamination systems, CBRN - COLPRO (Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear - Collective Protection) systems, and rescue boats. With 70 years of experience, LANCO has evolved from producing camping tents to developing advanced mobile tent systems, including inflatable and frame-supported tents. Their product range includes tents with 40 mm aluminum frames, medical and recreation tents, multi-purpose tents, double-roof tents, accommodation tents, kitchen and work tents, civil protection tents, inflatable tents (ARZ, AZF, AZM, RAPID, INX), outer frame tents, tent halls, party tents, semi-circular frame tents, folding tents (FZ PRO, FRZ), decontamination systems (for personnel and mass decontamination), water management solutions, CBRN-COLPRO ABC protection tents, temporary buildings (aircraft hangars, aluminum lightweight halls), and rescue boats. They also offer accessories such as connection modules, folding furniture, inner tents, and sanitary systems.

LANCO serves a diverse range of sectors, including government organizations, the military, international aid organizations, public authorities, and commercial clients worldwide. Their products are used in various applications, such as civil protection, fire departments, rescue services, aid organizations, triage, field hospitals, first aid stations, decontamination and hazardous materials operations, military operations, weather-resistant accommodations and workshops, accommodation and catering, youth groups, business, HORECA (hotel, restaurant, and catering), advertising, industry, and trade. LANCO highlights its commitment to progress, innovation, and research, emphasizing that all its products undergo thorough development, design, and practical testing. The company's mobile tent systems are manufactured in Europe and are equipped with accessories like lamps, generators, heaters, air filtration systems, sanitary solutions, and flexible liquid tanks.

description: GENSPEED Biotech GmbH, founded in 2016 as a spin-off of Greiner Bio-One, develops, produces, and sells in-vitro diagnostics. They offer a range of rapid tests based on their patented GENSPEED µELISA platform, focusing on near-patient diagnosis. Their key technology combines microfluidics, miniaturized opto-electronics, and automation to enable rapid, sensitive detection of multiple analytes at the point of care. The GENSPEED system can be used for both nucleic acid-based genetic testing and protein analyses, facilitating the rapid identification of bacteria or viruses, as well as the quantification of antibodies and biomarkers. Their product portfolio includes the Vitamin D xPOC test for quantitative detection of Vitamin D levels from blood samples, approved under In-Vitro Diagnostic Regulation (EU 2017/746), GENSPEED Immunoassays for detecting various biomarkers (antibodies, antigens, special biomarker proteins), and PerioPOC Pro for identifying periodontal pathogens in dental offices. The company targets assay manufacturers seeking fast and reliable near-patient testing, as well as healthcare professionals needing rapid diagnostic tools. They are EN ISO 13485:2012 & EN ISO 9001:2008 certified.

description: The European Vaccine Initiative (EVI) is a leading European non-profit Product Development Partnership (PDP) established in 1998. It supports global efforts to develop safe, effective, and affordable vaccines against diseases of poverty and emerging infectious diseases, particularly those disproportionately affecting low- and middle-income countries. EVI engages in translational product development, cross-cutting activities, and knowledge sharing & advocacy to catalyze vaccine development. Their translational product development focuses on bridging early-stage vaccine candidates from discovery to early clinical trials. Cross-cutting activities involve harmonizing stakeholders, promoting networking, developing innovative R&D solutions, and accessing vaccine infrastructure. Knowledge sharing and advocacy aim to improve knowledge access and vaccine uptake. EVI's services include project & network management, operational R&D support, trainings in vaccinology, communication & dissemination, clinical trial support, and fund raising & grant management. They work with academia, pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, policy makers, donors, and other PDPs. EVI's mission is to develop new, safe, effective, and affordable vaccines for global health through collaboration and coordination, with a vision of a world where vaccines create health and equity for all people. They support vaccine R&D for diseases like Malaria, Leishmaniasis, Diarrhoeal diseases, Emerging epidemics and AMR. They have supported over 40 vaccine formulations clinically tested and + 100 preclinical vaccine candidates with over 200 partners worldwide.

description: ATM Recyclingsystems GmbH, a member of the ASCO Group International, is a leading company specializing in metal recycling systems. With over 80 years of experience (Arnold Technology for Metal Recycling), they develop, plan, manufacture, and service recycling systems for processing secondary raw materials. Their solutions encompass a wide range of materials, including steel, aluminum, copper, titanium, brass, grinding sludge, stamping waste, heavy scrap, cast iron scrap, light scrap (like aluminum cans), batteries, slags, and PV panels. ATM offers technologies such as briquetting, baling, cutting, crushing, shredding, sieving, and sorting, along with products like briquetting presses, baling presses, scrap shears, cast breakers, rail breakers, shredders, screening plants, material handling, and sorting machines. They provide services including R&D, testing, competence center, research projects, service packages, smart recycling services, contract manufacturing, machine repair, and spare parts. ATM emphasizes customer-oriented service, quality consciousness, efficiency orientation, sustainability, community, and trust. They offer customized solutions for efficient chip recycling, from individual solutions to complete systems, aligning with the Green Steel concept for climate-friendly and sustainable production. ATM's systems process materials into chips, dust, sludge, and mixed briquettes. They also provide solutions for stamping waste processing, using baling systems to compact light scrap for efficient recycling. Their product line includes Arno® Shred shredders, Arno® Press baling presses, and Arno® Handle material handling systems. ATM targets industries dealing with metal scrap and waste, offering solutions for efficient and sustainable recycling processes.

description: Bionic Surface Technologies (BST), based in Graz, Austria, is a global research and development company specializing in surface textures, particularly Riblet surfaces, designed to reduce fluid-dynamic drag. Their core business revolves around the development, optimization, testing, and evaluation of these surfaces, which feature nano- or micro-structures. BST's primary offering is Riblet technology, which aims to improve aerodynamic efficiency and reduce fuel consumption across various industries. They cater to a diverse range of sectors, including biomedical, energy, plant & mechanical engineering, processes, pulp & paper, and transport, offering solutions for industrial fans, professional racing, and civil aviation. BST leverages Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) analysis as a key tool, with specializations in pulp & paper, acoustics, and microfluidics. They provide testing and evaluation services using in-house test facilities and actively engage in publicly- and self-funded research to advance Riblet technology. BST's Riblet technology has demonstrated up to 4% reduced fuel consumption in business jets (investigated with Lufthansa Technik), up to 3% increased efficiency for industrial fans, and up to 0.3s faster lap times in professional racing. The company's vision is to establish an extensive, cross-industry use of Riblet surfaces to achieve higher efficiencies and facilitate sustainability, positioning themselves as a technology leader and driving force in related research. They offer a comprehensive application process, including requirement evaluation, customized design, surface application (film, laser, coating), and maintenance service. BST's clients include Nikon, Red Bull, Lufthansa Technik, ANDRITZ, and many others across various industries.

description: The Verein Autonome Österreichische Frauenhäuser - AÖF (Association of Autonomous Austrian Women's Shelters) is an umbrella organization for 16 autonomous women's shelters in Austria. Founded in 1988, it serves as an information hub, support system, service provider, and representative for its members. The AÖF also houses several key pillars of violence prevention, including: 1) The Informationsstelle gegen Gewalt (Information Center against Violence), responsible for networking and exchange among the women's shelters and raising awareness about domestic violence. 2) The Frauenhelpline gegen Gewalt 0800 222 555, a nationwide, multilingual, anonymous, and free 24/7 telephone counseling service for victims of domestic violence. 3) The online counseling service "HelpChat - Halt der Gewalt," available daily for women and girls affected by violence. 4) StoP - Stadtteile ohne Partnergewalt, a violence prevention project aimed at preventing domestic violence, partner violence, and femicides by encouraging neighborhood intervention. 5) The Zentrum BAKHTI für EmPOWERment, a center in Vienna offering workshops, counseling, and creative activities for girls and young women. The AÖF is a member of WAVE - Women Against Violence Europe. In 2023, the AÖF celebrated its 35th anniversary and the 25th anniversary of the Frauenhelpline. The organization provides various resources, including statistics on femicides and attempted murders, and advocates for laws protecting against violence.

description: Unikraft is a company focused on revolutionizing cloud infrastructure by providing a millisecond, true serverless platform. They address the issue of over-provisioning in cloud computing caused by legacy technology designed for slower processing times. Unikraft aims to offer a cloud-native OS and cloud stack that eliminates inefficiencies like cold boots and bloated images. Their key principles include millisecond performance for scaling and cold starts, superior economics through efficient resource utilization, and a zero-disruption developer experience by integrating with tools like Docker and Kubernetes. Unikraft Cloud provides features such as millisecond scale-to-zero and autoscale, high server density, and reduced memory consumption. The company's technology is based on the open-source Unikraft project, a Unikernel Development Kit. They offer a free plan for small projects and hobbyists, providing 'Always-On' Instances, storage, and egress traffic. They also provide serverless proxies, end-to-end solutions, serverless databases, serverless frameworks, and serverless languages & runtimes. The company targets developers and organizations looking to optimize cloud infrastructure costs and performance.

description: PlasmaVita Healthcare GmbH, based in Leipzig, Germany, specializes in the collection of human blood plasma for the production of human pharmaceuticals. The company plays a crucial role in plasma donation and patient care, addressing the increasing demand for plasma-based medications. They operate donation centers in multiple cities including Annaberg-Buchholz, Chemnitz, Frankfurt, Magdeburg, Mannheim, Saarbrücken, Stuttgart, and Ulm. PlasmaVita focuses on providing a safe and compensated donation process, including a free health check and free Wi-Fi in their centers. The process involves extracting plasma from the donor's arm vein, separating it from blood cells using a centrifuge, and returning the blood cells to the body. Donors must be at least 18 years old and weigh over 50 kg, with regular health checks to ensure suitability. PlasmaVita emphasizes the importance of truthful donor information to ensure patient safety. They also highlight patient stories to show how plasma donations contribute to life-saving medications, particularly for individuals with immune deficiencies.

description:
evidanza is a company that provides a Corporate Performance Management (CPM) platform. The platform aims to help companies manage their business in a data-driven, integrated, and future-proof manner, enhancing transparency, efficiency, and decision-making confidence. The evidanza CPM platform combines tools for successful corporate management, offering flexibility, scalability, and customization. It supports analysis, planning, and automation, providing a foundation for informed decisions and sustainable growth. 

The platform's features include Business Intelligence dashboards and KPIs, Business Planning for corporate, financial, liquidity, budget, personnel, and sales planning, as well as planning for ERP systems. It also offers Business Process Management and a data automation platform with an App Builder and Middleware. Standard solutions include DATEV-Reporting, Finance & Controlling, Lohn & Gehalt (Payroll), and Personal-Zeiterfassung (PZE) (Time Tracking). 

The platform supports various departments, including CEO & CFO, Controlling, Project Controlling, HR-Controlling & Personal, Production, Warenwirtschaft (Inventory Management), and Processes. It also offers solutions for Management Controlling, Process Management, Digitalization, and Data Management for BI- & Planning systems. These include the "Höhere Lehranstalt für Tourismus (HLT)", a 5-year vocational higher school leading to a Matura and diploma, and the "Kolleg für Tourismus", a 4-semester full-time study program after the Matura, also concluding with a diploma. The school emphasizes a blend of tradition and modern lifestyle, fostering an international network through the "KTS Family". KTS provides additional qualifications such as Jungsommelier, Jungbarkeeper, Barista and Jungbiersommelier certifications. The school also offers Erasmus+ programs for international experience. The KTS campus includes an internat (boarding school), an Abendrestaurant (evening restaurant) called Wintergarten, and a GenussCampus, focusing on regional and seasonal products in line with Slow Food and Genussland Kärnten values. The school promotes a strong sense of community through various activities and events. KTS also supports social and charity projects. The school aims to provide a solid foundation for a successful career in tourism, hospitality, and related fields, with graduates pursuing diverse paths such as hotel management, gastronomy, journalism, and entrepreneurship.

description: Coldplasmatech is a German company revolutionizing wound healing through its innovative cold plasma therapy. Their core offering is the CPT®patch, an active wound dressing that utilizes cold, physical plasma to treat chronic wounds. The company targets patients suffering from chronic and slow-healing wounds, such as diabetic foot syndrome, pressure ulcers, venous ulcers, and burns, as well as healthcare professionals and clinics seeking advanced wound care solutions. Coldplasmatech's business model involves providing the CPT®patch and CPT®cube (a control unit) for use in clinics and treatment centers. The technology is based on the patented Active Glow® Technology, which generates a cold plasma that is safe for skin application. This plasma has antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and wound-healing properties, including the ability to combat multi-resistant bacteria. The CPT®patch ensures that the plasma is contained within the wound area, maximizing its effectiveness. Coldplasmatech's unique selling proposition lies in its ability to offer a pain-free, effective, and fast-acting treatment for chronic wounds, often achieving wound closure within a few weeks, even in cases where conventional treatments have failed. The company aims to improve the quality of life for patients with chronic wounds by providing a solution that promotes healing and reduces complications.

description: HOPF Vertriebsgesellschaft mbH is a German company specializing in automation and network technology solutions for industrial applications. description: Components at Service GmbH (CAS) is an international distributor of electronic components and IT hardware. Founded in 2000 by Martina Zillner as an independent distributor, CAS evolved from Zillner Elektronik GmbH, which was established in 1949 by Wilhelm Zillner. CAS provides distribution services, special procurement for obsolete parts and supply bottlenecks, and emphasizes quality assurance, including a dedicated Q-LAB testing facility. They offer services such as annual demand procurement with flexible call-off options, pre-financing, and warehousing for up to two years. CAS aims to be a reliable partner by offering cost advantages through global sourcing, fast and flexible responses, and high-quality standards. Their mission is to elevate the purchasing experience for their customers and act as a long-term partner for electronic components and IT hardware, focusing on customer satisfaction and tailored solutions. CAS is committed to sustainability, aiming to be the most sustainable distributor for electronic components in the German market by 2030. They focus on emissions control, efficient resource use, waste reduction, and logistics optimization. The company serves various industries, including automotive, medical technology, energy, and security technology. CAS is headquartered in Oberhaching near Munich, Germany, with another location in Busto Arsizio, Italy. Their values include family, engagement, reliability, independence, and sustainability.

Their products, manufactured in Germany, are designed for high reliability in challenging environments. The company provides a range of products including digital and analog intercom stations (desktop, wall-mounted, and weather-proof), loudspeakers (including explosion-proof and weather-proof models), audio device modules, and system servers. Their solutions cater to industries like transportation (railways) and general industrial applications. Neumann Elektronik offers the TIMM V4.0 communication system and the PACE-VA EN 54-16 voice alarm system. They provide both intercom and PA systems suitable for potentially explosive environments (Ex-areas). The systems feature a modular, decentralized structure, high speech quality, redundant system design for reliability, and interfaces to other systems like telephony and video. The company provides 24-hour service support. They offer solutions for the industry, traffic, train, and public transport sectors. The Neumann intercom stations are universally used, allowing communication with other stations, loudspeaker announcements and local function programming. The latest developments expand the interfaces and cover all protocols and standards of the industry and railway technology.

description: Class 5 Photonics is a company specializing in ultrafast, high-power laser systems and EUV (Extreme Ultraviolet) technology. They build pioneering lasers from extreme ultraviolet to terahertz, based on optical parametric chirped pulse amplification (OPCPA) and advanced nonlinear optical technologies, such as high-harmonic generation (HHG). Their products include tunable OPCPA systems, lasers for multiphoton microscopy (2-photon and 3-photon), micromachining lasers, XUV HHG sources, and Ho:YLF Gigawatt Lasers. Key products include the White Dwarf series (2p, 3p, TPA, HE, Attodriver, dual, hybrid), Supernova OPCPA, Black Dwarf lasers (2P, High-power femtosecond), Moonlander HHG EUV source, and THORA 2050 high-energy mid-IR picosecond laser. These systems are used in applications such as multiphoton microscopy, material science & photo-electron spectroscopy, EUV/XUV imaging & metrology, and attosecond science. The company's mission is to deliver high-performance laser systems and EUV technology to advance demanding applications in bio-imaging, material science, and attosecond science. Class 5 Photonics was founded in 2014 as a spin-off of Deutsches Elektronen-Synchrotron DESY and the Helmholtz-Institute Jena. They offer award-winning products and continuously innovate to enable researchers in physics, chemistry, and biology to conduct outstanding research. They emphasize competence through their experienced team and excellence in service with fast response times and remote service capabilities. Their THORA 2050 is described as the world’s most powerful ultrafast Ho:YLF laser platform.

description: The Heinrich Kimmle Stiftung is a German church-based foundation established in 1965 that supports individuals with disabilities. As a regional organization for disability assistance, it provides support in the areas of work, housing, and pre-school and school education, aiming to enable a life that is as independent and self-reliant as possible. The foundation operates CAP Märkte (grocery stores), a Werbetechnik (advertising technology) service, a Pulverbeschichtung (powder coating) service, Gartenarbeit (gardening) services, a Schreinerei (carpentry), a Küchenteam (kitchen team) providing meals, and Verpackung & Montage (packaging & assembly) services. It also runs Bilder.de, producing individual photo gifts. The foundation's services include integrative kindergartens, a school with a focus on holistic development (Pirminiusschule), residential facilities (Wohnanlage Pirminius), individual support services, workshops for people with disabilities at eight locations, and inclusion companies (Pirminius-Werk gGmbH) to create transitions into the labor market and labor market services. The Pirminius-Werk gGmbH is a non-profit integration company founded by the Heinrich Kimmle Stiftung to integrate people with disabilities into the general labor market. The foundation's workshops employ approximately 900 people with disabilities or mental illnesses in the Pirmasens, Zweibrücken, and Südwestpfalz areas, offering jobs in industrial contract manufacturing, general services, and in-house production. The Integrationsdienst (integration service) facilitates transitions into the general labor market and provides labor market services such as InbeQ and Dia-AM. The purpose of the foundation is to individually support and promote people with disabilities on their life paths with the goal of realizing social participation and enabling a largely self-determined life.

description: The Wildau Institute of Technology (WIT) is an affiliated institute of the Technische Hochschule Wildau (TH Wildau) offering part-time and full-time master's and certificate programs. TH Wildau is one of Germany's strongest research universities. WIT focuses on providing practically oriented, career-integrated studies, combining business relevance with academic quality. Their programs are designed for engineers, economists, and social scientists in leadership positions. They offer a Master of Aviation Management (AVIMA), a Master of Science in Bibliotheksinformatik (Library Informatics), and a Zertifikatsstudium Mathematik SEK I (Certificate program in Mathematics for secondary school teachers). The Aviation Management program is a two-year, English-language master's program covering Aviation Management, Business Administration & Management, and Management & Social Skills. The Bibliotheksinformatik program covers informatics, programming, databases, search engines, interfaces, data formats, library management systems, IT security, data security, and artificial intelligence. The Mathematik SEK I program aims to enhance the skills of teachers in mathematics education for secondary level I. WIT emphasizes current teaching content, the academic and economic experience of its lecturers, and close cooperation with leading companies. They use modern learning methods such as case studies, simulations, excursions, and visits. WIT is committed to addressing current and future challenges in education, including the further education of employees in the aviation and business administration sectors and the qualification of Brandenburg teachers in mathematics. The institute is located near Berlin and is easily accessible by public transport.

description: The Centre for Planetary Health Policy (CPHP) is a think tank established in late 2021 by the German Alliance on Climate Change and Health (KLUG). It aims to advance scientific policy advice at the intersection of global environmental change and health, placing planetary health high on the policy agenda. CPHP assists policymakers in translating scientific knowledge into effective policy programs. Its team of researchers develops application-oriented studies and synthesizes evidence to provide clear recommendations for action, communicating this knowledge to politicians, scientists, and the public. The organization focuses on identifying ways to translate Planetary Health Policy into concrete transformation paths, from the municipal to the international level. CPHP acts as a link between health professionals, academia, and policymakers, fostering collaboration to develop a common understanding of planetary crises and sustainable solutions. The organization strives to create a vision for a resilient, accessible, environmentally friendly, and financially viable healthcare system. CPHP operates under the umbrella of KLUG, with synergies arising from close cooperation at the content and organizational level. The think tank prepares and represents its analyses independently, especially with regard to the influence of political parties, governments and commercial actors. It exclusively focuses on the protection and promotion of health within planetary boundaries. CPHP works on the basis of the best available scientific evidence and follows the guidelines of good scientific practice, based on the Code of Conduct of the German Research Foundation (DFG).

description: CS Additive GmbH is a German company specializing in carburizing agents and carbon materials for demanding applications. They are a leading producer of carburizing agents for steelworks and iron foundries, offering premium quality products under the CARBOLUX® brand for over 40 years. Their product portfolio also includes specially processed carbon qualities for the brake pad industry and various specialized applications. CS Additive is a market leader in low-sulfur carburizing agent pellets, utilizing long-term strategic raw material partnerships to secure access to high-purity graphite dusts, which are processed into graphite pellets at their carbon plant in Brüggen. These graphite pellets are nearly free of sulfur and nitrogen, making them suitable for the production of spheroidal graphite iron, vermicular graphite iron, and gray cast iron, as well as nitrogen-sensitive, high-carbon steels. The company emphasizes secure raw material sources, high economic efficiency, low sulfur and nitrogen content, high carbon yield, consistent chemical composition, and high availability. They offer expert consultation to optimize customer processes and find suitable products for specific requirements.

description: Alliance Medical is a leading European provider of mobile diagnostic imaging services, operating for over 30 years. They offer solutions to bridge system failures and expand capacities, focusing on diagnostic imaging expertise. Their services include mobile MRI, CT, PET-CT, and X-ray solutions, providing temporary replacements during system upgrades or downtime, as well as daily service solutions with qualified personnel. Alliance Medical Radiopharmacy manufactures and distributes short-lived radiotracers for nuclear medicine diagnostics nationally and internationally, emphasizing product quality and supply reliability through a backup system. They also offer in-house services, modular buildings/container solutions, and radiopharmaceutical services. The company supports patients, customers, and business partners to optimize patient care, offering diagnostic imaging systems without capital expenditure or financial risk, taking on administrative and financial burdens. Alliance Medical serves clinics, private institutes, and OEMs, aiming to be at the forefront of service development. They focus on building long-term partnerships through high-quality service, training, and investment, emphasizing sustainability through integrated systems, efficiency, and expertise. Quality, service, safety, and transparency are prioritized. Alliance Medical supports customers and partners with capacity bottlenecks during renovation, system replacement, or downtime, as well as with missing premises with mobile diagnostic systems from the entry-level to the high-end solution. The Alliance Medical Group employs over 3,000 people worldwide and supports clinics, practices and companies with imaging diagnostics in the fields of radiology, nuclear medicine and urology.

description: Höppner Management & Consultant GmbH, established in 1997, is an independent German consulting firm specializing in management systems, legal registers (Rechtskataster), occupational safety (Arbeitsschutz), and environmental protection (Umweltschutz). With offices throughout Germany, the company provides nationwide services to both private and public sector clients. Höppner's core services include consulting and implementation support for various management systems (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, ISO 50001, EMAS), climate protection and sustainability strategies including CSRD reporting and carbon footprint analysis, energy audits, legal compliance, occupational and construction site safety, emergency and crisis management, environmental officer services, fire protection, and hazardous materials management. They also offer forward-looking services such as AI-based solutions, market analysis, and consulting related to e-fuels. The company emphasizes its nearly 30 years of experience, its commitment to long-term client relationships, and its ability to provide independent and customized solutions. Höppner serves a diverse range of industries and company sizes, focusing on enhancing their clients' competitiveness and legal compliance. Their expertise spans across various areas including waste management, soil and water protection, air quality, and climate protection.

description: Covendos GmbH, founded in 2009, is a German company specializing in efficient healthcare communication and providing remote services to the healthcare industry. With over 100 employees, they develop sales models and communication solutions for Pharma, MedTech, Medical Devices, Veterinary Medicine, Clinics, Dental, doctor's offices, health centers, health insurance companies, care facilities, nutritional supplements, functional food, and wellness sectors. Covendos builds bridges between traditional sales and multi-channel go-to-market models, offering services such as Pharmaberater im Innendienst (in-house pharmaceutical consultants), Medical Information Services, and Remote Training. Their services include Multi Channel Center, Sales Expert Unit, Smart Agency, and Academy Plus. They emphasize data protection, reconciliation, drug safety, and pharmacovigilance. Covendos' Medical Information Centers provide medical and scientific information to external and internal clients, handling inquiries from doctors, pharmacists, and patients via phone, email, and post, covering the DACH region. Services include triage and handling of medical inquiries, managing adverse events, monitoring medication intake, patient registration, and support. They also offer medical content and project management, research, review processes, module development for webinars, training materials, and quality control for sales divisions.
